name: Aussie Song Lyrics Quiz | International Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Whispered by the lead singer of which Aussie band was the lyric, "Can you please tell me what the time is"?
questions.explanation:
The Angels.

	"Doc" Neeson, lead singer of The Angels, whispered this line at the end of "No Secrets", a hugely popular song from 1980.

questions.text: "But it was all in the name of liberty" was sung by which huge Aussie rock band?
questions.explanation:
AC/DC.

	In 1976, Malcolm and Angus Young, along with then-lead singer Bon Scott, penned the song "Jailbreak", an absolutely 'ginormous' hit for AC/DC.

questions.text: Who sang, "You know the last plane out of Sydney's almost gone"?
questions.explanation:
Cold Chisel.

	Jimmy Barnes and Cold Chisel were outrageously successful; the song "Khe Sanh", written by Don Walker from their self-titled album "Cold Chisel", screamed up the charts in 1978.

questions.text: "He just smiled and gave me a vegemite sandwich", was a lyric sung by which Aussie band?
questions.explanation:
Men At Work.

	"Business As Usual" was the debut album for Men At Work.  The song, "Down Under", was a huge chart hit for Colin Hay and his band in late 1982 and through mid 1983.

questions.text: "Well there's a thousand guitars all over the land" is the opening lyric to a brilliant rock song by which great Aussie band?
questions.explanation:
Skyhooks.

	Penned by Greg Macainsh, Skyhooks released "Million Dollar Riff" from the album "Straight In A Gay Gay World" in 1976.

questions.text: This Newcastle band penned and sang the lyric, "Everywhere and everyone has something going wrong".  Who are they?
questions.explanation:
The Screaming Jets.

	In 1989, The Screaming Jets won the "Triple J" (radio station) national "Battle of the Bands".  In 2000, they released their hit song "Shine Over Me".

questions.text: Who sang, "I didn't know that it would be your last time with me"?
questions.explanation:
Noiseworks.

	"Take Me Back", from the "Noiseworks" album, was a huge hit for Noiseworks in 1987.

questions.text: Which Aussie band sings the opening lyric, "Let's kick on back to the places we know"?
questions.explanation:
Taxiride.

	Melbourne band Taxiride realeased "Creepin' Up Slowly" in 2002; within two weeks it was one of the most played songs on Australian radio. It's from their "Garage Mahal" album.

questions.text: Who sang "Mistakes don't mean a thing, if you don't regret them"?
questions.explanation:
Silverchair.

	Silverchair released the single "The Greatest View", from their "Diorama" album, in 2001.

questions.text: Who sang "Back in a flash I started on a dash of Jamaica rum"?
questions.explanation:
Mental As Anything.

	Written by Martin Plaza, "The Nips are Getting Bigger" was released in 1979.  From their debut album "Get Wet", it was a huge hit and is still very popular today!
